Description: Lower body and handle sherd of Chian pottery Simple Animal Style patterned chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with two added white lines; exterior: exterior of handle glazed streaky black; in handle zone to right of handle six vertical strokes between narrow lines; to right, double saw-edge metope pattern; single streaky black band on cul.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bryn Mawr, the Art and Artifact Collections. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1151) (phase 2)
